member.name: T:TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling
member.remarks:
This class provides methods to deal with texts extended by 'style tags'. A style tag defines the appearance of a text portion. A style tag is framed by braces. Each style tag can contain one or more style definitions. Style definitions are separated by semi colons. The definitions of a style tag are valid for the following text up to the next style tag. An empty style tag cancels all style definitions. If a brace should be part of the normal text it needs to be doubled.
Styles:
bold
italic
underline
color:<ColorDefinition>
forecolor:<ColorDefinition>
backcolor:<ColorDefinition>
size:<FontSize>
'color' is an abbreviation of 'forecolor'. ColorDefinition is one of the following color names: red, blue, green, yellow, black or white. Alternatively a RGB definition can be used: (<red value>,<green value>,<blue value>). The color value must be in the range from 0 and 255. The font size is set as a percentage size of the default font size. "size:200" means double size.

example.code: "normal text {color:red}red text {bold}bold text {color:blue;bold}bold text in blue {}normal text" "normal text {size:200}text with double size {size:50}text with half size {}normal text" "normal text {color:(128,128,128);backcolor:yellow}gray text on yellow background {}normal text" "normal text with an open brace {{ and a close brace }}"

member.name: F:TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling.StyleTag.ForeColor
member.summary: The fore color defined for the text portion. If the value is null the default fore color should be used.

member.name: F:TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling.StyleTag.BackColor
member.summary: The back color defined for the text portion. If the value is null the default back color should be used.

member.name: F:TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling.StyleTag.FontSizeFactor
member.summary: The font size factor defined for the text portion. The default font size should be multiplied with this factor. If the value is null the default fonts size should be used.

member.name: F:TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling.StyleTag.FontStyle
member.summary: The font style defined for the text portion. If the value is null the default font style should be used.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling.StyleTag.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Drawing.Color},System.Nullable{System.Drawing.Color},System.Nullable{System.Single},System.Nullable{System.Drawing.FontStyle},System.String)
member.param: The fore color defined for the text portion.
The back color defined for the text portion.
The font size factor defined for the text portion.
The font style defined for the text portion.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling.ParseExtendedText(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a list of style tag objects out of a text extended by style tags.
member.remarks: The text will be split into text portions for each style definition. For each portion a style tag with according style parameters will be created. For text portions without style definitions a style tag will be created also, with all style parameters set to null. Processing the style tags allows to apply the individual style of each text portion. Joining the texts of all style tags will create the plain original text.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling.RemoveStyleTags(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all style tags an returns the unformatted plain text.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.Convert.ConvertFromEng(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string with a number in engineering notation to a number.
member.remarks: If the Number string does not a contain a valid number, the returned value might be 0. In no case an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.Convert.ConvertToEng(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a number to a string in engineering notation.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.Convert.ConvertToEng(System.Double,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a number to a string in engineering notation.
member.param: Returned string if Number is NaN
Returned string if Number is max double or positive infinity
Returned string if Number is min double or negative infinity

member.name: T:TestFramework.Common.StatusLogging.Log
member.summary: Global log to note status messages and status changes. See also 'LogRecorder'.

member.name: F:TestFramework.Common.StatusLogging.Log.TextFormat.ExtendedStyle
member.summary: Text extended by style tags. See also 'TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling'.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.StatusLogging.Log.Note(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a message to all connected LogRecorders (requests 'display on screen' and 'write to log file').
member.param: Message text in extended style format. See also 'TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling'.
member.remarks: Example for a text in extended style format: "normal text {color:red}red text {italic}italic text {color:blue;bold;size:200}double sized bold text in blue {}normal text" See also 'TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling'.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.StatusLogging.Log.Note(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a message to all connected LogRecorders.
member.param: Message text in extended style format. See also 'TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling'.
True: requests the message to be displayed on screen.
True: requests the message to be written into the log file.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.StatusLogging.Log.Note(System.String,TestFramework.Common.StatusLogging.Log.TextFormat)
member.summary: Sends a message to all connected LogRecorders.

member.summary: Sends a message to all connected LogRecorders.
member.param: Message text in extended style format. See also 'TestFramework.Common.Text.Styling'.
True: requests the message to be displayed on screen.
True: requests the message to be written into the log file.

member.summary: Sends a status change to all connected LogRecorders.

Back color of the status display.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.StatusLogging.Log.SetStatus(System.String,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a status change to all connected LogRecorders.
member.param: Fore color of the status display.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.StatusLogging.Log.SetStatus(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a status change to all connected LogRecorders.
member.param: Fore color and back color in extended style format. Example: "ForeColor:Yellow;BackColor:Blue".
member.remarks:
The key words in extended style format are not case sensitive. ForeColor:<token<ColorName<token> BackColor:<token<ColorName<token>
ColorNames: red blue green yellow black white or as RGB definition: (<token<red value<token>,<token<green value<token>,<token<blue value<token>) The color value must be between 0 and 255.

member.name: M:TestFramework.Common.StatusLogging.Log.SetStatus(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a status change to all connected LogRecorders.
member.param: Fore color and back color in extended style format. Example: "ForeColor:Yellow;BackColor:Blue".
member.remarks:
The key words in extended style format are not case sensitive. ForeColor:<token<ColorName<token> BackColor:<token<ColorName<token>
ColorNames: red blue green yellow black white or as RGB definition: (<token<red value<token>,<token<green value<token>,<token<blue value<token>) The color value must be between 0 and 255.

member.summary: Determines if a storage space with the given name exists.

member.summary: Assigns an item to a storage space.

member.summary: Assigns an item to a storage space.
member.remarks: A copy ('clone') of the item will be stored.

member.remarks: A copy ('clone') of the stored item will be returned.
